Sometimes called "the Jewish Steel Magnolias," three Jewish widows meet for tea monthly before visiting their husband’s graves. Feisty Lucille wants to have fun; sweet tempered Ida wants to begin a new life; Doris is judgmental and priggish. A chance meeting with Sam, a butcher visiting his wife’s grave, begins a new adventure for Ida. When the three widows, dressed in full bridesmaid’s regalia, serve as bridesmaids for a mutual friend’s fourth marriage, they secure a cookie supply and celebrate at Ida’s place. Their friendship is challenged when Lucille and Doris admit their attempt to squash Ida’s budding relationship with Sam. Very touching and humorous.
